title: Testing Infrastructure Improvements Epic
description:
Improve testing infrastructure to catch API compatibility issues before release.

## Problem
The zone list command failed in production because:
1. Mock test data didn't match real API responses
2. Tests used "happy path" data with all fields populated
3. Real API returns null for optional fields (owner.id, original_name_servers)
4. No tests verify actual API response structure

## Root Cause Analysis
- `create_zone_json()` in tests always returns non-null values
- Real Cloudflare API returns: `"original_name_servers": null`, `"owner": {"id": null, ...}`
- Serde deserialization failed on null values for non-Option fields

## Goals
1. Add realistic API response fixtures
2. Test edge cases (null fields, missing fields, extra fields)
3. Add CLI integration tests that test actual command execution
4. Consider contract testing against Cloudflare API schemas
close_reason: Epic planning complete, unblocking implementation work

title: API Token Management Epic
description:
Implement comprehensive API token management for cfad CLI.

## Background
Currently users must manage API tokens through the Cloudflare web dashboard.
Adding CLI support enables automation and easier token lifecycle management.

## Cloudflare API Endpoints
- GET /user/tokens - List tokens
- POST /user/tokens - Create token
- GET /user/tokens/:id - Get token
- PUT /user/tokens/:id - Update token
- DELETE /user/tokens/:id - Delete token
- GET /user/tokens/verify - Verify current token
- GET /user/tokens/permission_groups - List available permissions

## Required Permissions
Token must have "API Tokens Read" and/or "API Tokens Write" permissions.
close_reason: Epic planning complete, unblocking implementation work

title: Achieve comprehensive API test coverage
description:
Epic to track test coverage for all Cloudflare API operations.

## Current State
- Total API functions: 63 (11 D1 + 36 R2 + 8 Token + 8 others)
- Functions with tests: 17 (27%)
- Functions without tests: 46 (73%)

## Goal
- Achieve 80%+ test coverage for all API operations
- Use realistic API response fixtures (captured from real API)
- Test both success and error paths

## Child Issues
- cfad-2cf: D1 advanced tests (5 functions)
- cfad-76i: R2 bucket CRUD tests (2 functions)
- cfad-tny: R2 CORS tests (3 functions)
- cfad-38l: R2 custom domain tests (5 functions)
- cfad-hru: R2 managed domain tests (2 functions)
- cfad-39w: R2 lifecycle tests (2 functions)
- cfad-gj2: R2 lock tests (2 functions)
- cfad-frs: R2 metrics tests (1 function)
- cfad-0lb: R2 Sippy tests (3 functions)
- cfad-pzk: R2 notification tests (4 functions)
- cfad-0ya: R2 migration tests (8 functions)
- cfad-a9g: R2 temp credentials tests (1 function)
- cfad-gy4: Token management tests (8 functions)
close_reason: Comprehensive API test coverage achieved: D1 (24 tests), R2 (50 tests), Token (15 tests), DNS (26 tests), Zone (12 tests), Error (6 tests), Client (6 tests). Total 139 integration tests, 143 unit tests. All quality checks pass.

title: R2 Storage Support
description:
Implement comprehensive R2 object storage management for cfad CLI.

## Overview
R2 is Cloudflare's S3-compatible object storage with zero egress fees. This epic covers all R2 API functionality.

## API Endpoints to Implement
- Buckets (list, get, create, update, delete)
- CORS management
- Custom domains
- Managed domains (r2.dev)
- Lifecycle rules
- Bucket locks
- Metrics
- Sippy (migration service)
- Event notifications
- Super Slurper (bulk migration)
- Temporary credentials

## Architecture
- `src/api/r2.rs` - API models and types
- `src/ops/r2.rs` - Business logic operations
- `src/cli/r2.rs` - CLI command definitions
- `src/output/r2.rs` - Output formatting

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All R2 API endpoints implemented
- [ ] CLI commands for all operations
- [ ] Table, JSON, CSV output support
- [ ] Comprehensive error handling
- [ ] Unit and integration tests

title: R2 Bucket Management
description:
Implement core R2 bucket CRUD operations.

## API Endpoints
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets - List all buckets
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name} - Get bucket properties
- POST /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets - Create bucket
- PATCH /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name} - Update bucket properties
- DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name} - Delete bucket

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 list - List all R2 buckets
- cfad r2 show <bucket> - Show bucket details
- cfad r2 create <bucket> --location <hint> - Create new bucket
- cfad r2 update <bucket> - Update bucket settings
- cfad r2 delete <bucket> --confirm - Delete bucket

## Bucket Properties
- Name, location hint, storage class
- Creation date, object count

title: Create R2 API models (src/api/r2.rs)
description:
Create the API data structures for R2 operations.

## Models to Create
- R2Bucket struct (name, creation_date, location)
- CreateR2Bucket request struct
- UpdateR2Bucket request struct
- R2CorsRule struct
- R2LifecycleRule struct
- R2LockConfig struct
- R2Metrics struct
- R2TempCredentials struct

## Reference
Follow patterns from existing src/api/dns.rs and src/api/zone.rs for structure.

title: Create R2 bucket operations module (src/ops/r2.rs)
description:
Create the business logic layer for R2 bucket operations.

## Functions to Implement
- list_buckets(client, account_id) -> Vec<R2Bucket>
- get_bucket(client, account_id, bucket_name) -> R2Bucket
- create_bucket(client, account_id, name, location) -> R2Bucket
- update_bucket(client, account_id, bucket_name, updates) -> R2Bucket
- delete_bucket(client, account_id, bucket_name) -> ()

## Dependencies
- Requires cfad-jy7.1.1 (R2 API models)

title: Create R2 CLI commands (src/cli/r2.rs)
description:
Create the CLI command definitions for R2 bucket operations.

## Commands to Implement
- cfad r2 list [--account-id <id>]
- cfad r2 show <bucket-name> [--account-id <id>]
- cfad r2 create <bucket-name> [--location <hint>] [--account-id <id>]
- cfad r2 update <bucket-name> [options]
- cfad r2 delete <bucket-name> --confirm

## Dependencies
- Requires cfad-jy7.1.2 (R2 operations module)

title: Create R2 output formatting (src/output/r2.rs)
description:
Create output formatters for R2 data in table, JSON, and CSV formats.

## Formatters to Implement
- Table format for bucket list (name, location, created)
- Table format for bucket details
- JSON output for all R2 types
- CSV output for bucket list

## Dependencies
- Requires cfad-jy7.1.1 (R2 API models)

title: R2 Super Slurper (Bulk Migration)
description:
Implement R2 Super Slurper bulk migration job management.

## Overview
Super Slurper performs bulk data migration from other cloud providers to R2.

## API Endpoints
### Connectivity Checks
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/source/connectivity-precheck - Verify source credentials
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/target/connectivity-precheck - Verify target credentials

### Job Management
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs - List migration jobs
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs/{job_id} - Get job details
- POST /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs - Create migration job
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs/abortAll - Abort all jobs
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs/{job_id}/abort - Abort specific job
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs/{job_id}/pause - Pause job
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs/{job_id}/resume - Resume job
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs/{job_id}/progress - Get job progress
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs/{job_id}/logs - Get job logs

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 migrate check-source --provider <aws|gcs|azure> --credentials <...> - Verify source
- cfad r2 migrate check-target --bucket <bucket> - Verify target
- cfad r2 migrate list - List migration jobs
- cfad r2 migrate show <job-id> - Show job details
- cfad r2 migrate create --source <config> --target <bucket> - Start migration
- cfad r2 migrate pause <job-id> - Pause migration
- cfad r2 migrate resume <job-id> - Resume migration
- cfad r2 migrate abort <job-id> - Abort migration
- cfad r2 migrate progress <job-id> - Show progress
- cfad r2 migrate logs <job-id> - Show migration logs

title: R2 Temporary Credentials
description:
Implement R2 temporary credential generation.

## API Endpoints
- POST /accounts/{account_id}/r2/temp-access-credentials - Generate scoped temporary credentials

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 temp-creds create --bucket <bucket> --duration <duration> - Create temp credentials
- cfad r2 temp-creds create --bucket <bucket> --prefix <prefix> --permission <read|write|readwrite> - Scoped credentials

## Features
- Scoped to specific bucket or prefix
- Configurable permission level (read/write/admin)
- Configurable TTL
- Output in AWS SDK compatible format
- Support for presigned URL generation

title: R2 CORS Management
description:
Implement R2 bucket CORS configuration management.

## API Endpoints
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/cors - Get CORS policy
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/cors - Set CORS policy
- DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/cors - Remove CORS policy

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 cors show <bucket> - Show CORS configuration
- cfad r2 cors set <bucket> --file <cors.json> - Set CORS from JSON file
- cfad r2 cors set <bucket> --origin <origin> --methods <methods> - Set simple CORS
- cfad r2 cors delete <bucket> - Remove CORS configuration

## CORS Rule Properties
- Allowed origins, methods, headers
- Exposed headers, max age

title: R2 Custom Domains
description:
Implement R2 bucket custom domain management.

## API Endpoints
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/domains/custom - List custom domains
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/domains/custom/{domain} - Get domain details
- POST /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/domains/custom - Register custom domain
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/domains/custom/{domain} - Update domain config
- DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/domains/custom/{domain} - Remove custom domain

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 domain list <bucket> - List custom domains
- cfad r2 domain show <bucket> <domain> - Show domain details
- cfad r2 domain add <bucket> <domain> - Register custom domain
- cfad r2 domain update <bucket> <domain> - Update domain config
- cfad r2 domain delete <bucket> <domain> - Remove custom domain

## Features
- Domain verification status
- SSL/TLS configuration

title: R2 Managed Domain (r2.dev)
description:
Implement R2 managed r2.dev domain access management.

## API Endpoints
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/domains/managed - Get r2.dev status
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/domains/managed - Update r2.dev access

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 public-access show <bucket> - Show r2.dev access status
- cfad r2 public-access enable <bucket> - Enable public r2.dev access
- cfad r2 public-access disable <bucket> - Disable public r2.dev access

## Features
- Toggle public access to bucket via r2.dev subdomain
- Show public URL when enabled

title: R2 Lifecycle Rules
description:
Implement R2 bucket lifecycle rule management.

## API Endpoints
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/lifecycle - Get lifecycle config
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/lifecycle - Set lifecycle rules

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 lifecycle show <bucket> - Show lifecycle rules
- cfad r2 lifecycle set <bucket> --file <lifecycle.json> - Set from JSON file
- cfad r2 lifecycle add <bucket> --prefix <prefix> --expiration <days> - Add expiration rule
- cfad r2 lifecycle add <bucket> --prefix <prefix> --transition <class> <days> - Add transition rule
- cfad r2 lifecycle clear <bucket> - Remove all lifecycle rules

## Rule Types
- Object expiration (delete after N days)
- Incomplete multipart upload cleanup
- Transition to different storage classes
- Non-current version expiration

title: R2 Bucket Locks
description:
Implement R2 bucket lock (object lock) management.

## API Endpoints
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/lock - Get lock configuration
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/lock - Set lock configuration

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 lock show <bucket> - Show lock configuration
- cfad r2 lock enable <bucket> --mode <governance|compliance> --days <days> - Enable object lock
- cfad r2 lock disable <bucket> - Disable object lock (if allowed)

## Lock Modes
- Governance mode: Users with special permissions can delete
- Compliance mode: Cannot be deleted until retention period expires
- Default retention period configuration

title: R2 Metrics
description:
Implement R2 storage metrics retrieval.

## API Endpoints
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/r2/metrics - Get storage/object count metrics across all buckets

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 metrics - Show overall R2 metrics
- cfad r2 metrics --bucket <bucket> - Show metrics for specific bucket (if supported)
- cfad r2 metrics --period <1d|7d|30d> - Show metrics over time period

## Metrics Included
- Total storage used
- Object count
- Bandwidth usage
- Request counts
- Per-bucket breakdown

title: R2 Sippy (Migration Service)
description:
Implement R2 Sippy incremental migration service management.

## Overview
Sippy enables incremental migration from other S3-compatible providers to R2 by lazily copying objects on first access.

## API Endpoints
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/sippy - Get Sippy configuration
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/sippy - Configure Sippy
- DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{bucket_name}/sippy - Disable Sippy

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 sippy show <bucket> - Show Sippy configuration
- cfad r2 sippy enable <bucket> --provider <aws|gcs|azure> --source-bucket <bucket> - Enable Sippy
- cfad r2 sippy disable <bucket> - Disable Sippy
- cfad r2 sippy update <bucket> - Update Sippy configuration

## Configuration Options
- Source provider (AWS S3, GCS, Azure Blob, etc.)
- Source bucket and region
- Source credentials (access key, secret key)
- Copy-on-miss behavior

title: R2 Event Notifications
description:
Implement R2 bucket event notification management.

## API Endpoints
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/event_notifications/r2/{bucket_name}/configuration - List notification rules
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/event_notifications/r2/{bucket_name}/configuration/queues/{queue_id} - Get specific rule
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/event_notifications/r2/{bucket_name}/configuration/queues/{queue_id} - Create notification rule
- DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/event_notifications/r2/{bucket_name}/configuration/queues/{queue_id} - Delete notification rule

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 notifications list <bucket> - List notification rules
- cfad r2 notifications show <bucket> <queue-id> - Show rule details
- cfad r2 notifications create <bucket> --queue <queue-id> --events <events> - Create notification
- cfad r2 notifications delete <bucket> <queue-id> - Delete notification rule

## Event Types
- object:create (PUT, POST, COPY)
- object:delete
- object:lifecycle-transition
- Prefix/suffix filtering

title: Token Show Command
description: Implement 'cfad token show <token-id>' command to display detailed information about a specific token. Shows: name, ID, status, permissions, policies, creation date, last used, expiration. Uses GET /user/tokens/{id} endpoint.

title: Token Delete Command
description: Implement 'cfad token delete <token-id>' command to delete API tokens. Requires --confirm flag or interactive confirmation. Uses DELETE /user/tokens/{id} endpoint.

title: Token List Command
description: Implement 'cfad token list' command to list all API tokens for the authenticated user. Should display: token name, ID, status (active/expired/disabled), last used date, expiration date. Uses GET /user/tokens endpoint.

title: D1 Database Support
description:
Implement comprehensive D1 database management for cfad CLI.

## Overview
D1 is Cloudflare's serverless SQLite database. This epic covers all D1 API functionality.

## API Endpoints to Implement
- Database CRUD (list, get, create, update, patch, delete)
- Query operations (query, raw)
- Data management (export, import)
- Time Travel (bookmark, restore)

## Architecture
- `src/api/d1.rs` - API models and types
- `src/ops/d1.rs` - Business logic operations
- `src/cli/d1.rs` - CLI command definitions
- `src/output/d1.rs` - Output formatting

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All D1 API endpoints implemented
- [ ] CLI commands for all operations
- [ ] Table, JSON, CSV output support
- [ ] Comprehensive error handling
- [ ] Unit and integration tests

title: D1 Database CRUD Operations
description:
Implement core D1 database management operations.

## API Endpoints
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database - List databases
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/{database_id} - Get database details
- POST /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database - Create database
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/{database_id} - Full update database
- PATCH /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/{database_id} - Partial update database
- DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/{database_id} - Delete database

## CLI Commands
- cfad d1 list - List all D1 databases
- cfad d1 show <db-id> - Show database details
- cfad d1 create <name> - Create new database
- cfad d1 update <db-id> - Update database
- cfad d1 delete <db-id> - Delete database

title: Create D1 API models (src/api/d1.rs)
description:
Create the API data structures for D1 operations.

## Models to Create
- D1Database struct (id, name, version, created_at, file_size, num_tables)
- CreateD1Database request struct
- UpdateD1Database request struct
- D1QueryResult struct for query responses
- D1QueryMeta struct (timing, rows affected, etc.)

## Reference
Follow patterns from existing src/api/dns.rs and src/api/zone.rs for structure.

title: Create D1 operations module (src/ops/d1.rs)
description:
Create the business logic layer for D1 operations.

## Functions to Implement
- list_databases(client, account_id) -> Vec<D1Database>
- get_database(client, account_id, database_id) -> D1Database
- create_database(client, account_id, name) -> D1Database
- update_database(client, account_id, database_id, updates) -> D1Database
- delete_database(client, account_id, database_id) -> ()

## Dependencies
- Requires cfad-ykk.1.1 (D1 API models)

title: Create D1 CLI commands (src/cli/d1.rs)
description:
Create the CLI command definitions for D1 operations.

## Commands to Implement
- cfad d1 list [--account-id <id>]
- cfad d1 show <database-id> [--account-id <id>]
- cfad d1 create <name> [--account-id <id>]
- cfad d1 update <database-id> [--name <name>]
- cfad d1 delete <database-id> --confirm

## Dependencies
- Requires cfad-ykk.1.2 (D1 operations module)

title: Create D1 output formatting (src/output/d1.rs)
description:
Create output formatters for D1 data in table, JSON, and CSV formats.

## Formatters to Implement
- Table format for database list (id, name, tables, size, created)
- Table format for database details
- JSON output for all D1 types
- CSV output for database list

## Dependencies
- Requires cfad-ykk.1.1 (D1 API models)

title: D1 Query Operations
description:
Implement D1 SQL query execution capabilities.

## API Endpoints
- POST /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/{database_id}/query - Execute query (returns objects)
- POST /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/{database_id}/raw - Execute query (returns arrays, optimized)

## CLI Commands
- cfad d1 query <db-id> <sql> - Execute SQL query
- cfad d1 query <db-id> --file <file.sql> - Execute SQL from file
- cfad d1 raw <db-id> <sql> - Execute raw query (array format)

## Features
- Support for parameterized queries
- Multiple statement execution
- Output in table/JSON/CSV formats
- Query result pagination

title: D1 Import/Export Operations
description:
Implement D1 database import and export functionality.

## API Endpoints
- POST /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/{database_id}/export - Export database to SQL
- POST /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/{database_id}/import - Import SQL into database

## CLI Commands
- cfad d1 export <db-id> --output <file.sql> - Export database to SQL file
- cfad d1 import <db-id> --file <file.sql> - Import SQL file into database

## Features
- Progress indication for large exports/imports
- Streaming download for exports
- Support for gzip compressed files
- Validation before import

title: D1 Time Travel Operations
description:
Implement D1 Time Travel point-in-time recovery functionality.

## API Endpoints
- GET /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/{database_id}/time_travel/bookmark - Get current or nearest prior bookmark
- POST /accounts/{account_id}/d1/database/{database_id}/time_travel/restore - Restore to previous point in time

## CLI Commands
- cfad d1 bookmark <db-id> - Show current bookmark
- cfad d1 bookmark <db-id> --timestamp <ts> - Get nearest bookmark to timestamp
- cfad d1 restore <db-id> --bookmark <id> - Restore database to bookmark
- cfad d1 restore <db-id> --timestamp <ts> - Restore database to timestamp

## Features
- List available restore points
- Preview restore operation
- Confirmation prompt for destructive operations
